text: Hi Thomas, yes I looked. There is only a google tag manager added. It's really a mystery where it comes from this tracking code.

Ideally, all alt tags would be manually written to make them as useful as possible. I imagine someone can think of a way to auto-translate alt tags though. Would they be good enough to serve their purpose? Not sure.

Google does want to see them translated though: <https://www.seroundtable.com/google-translate-image-alt-tags-25133.html>

I imagine it will also be helpful in making your content more accessible to those who benefit the most from alt tags.

I’m following along because I’m curious if anyone has a good solution here. Unfortunately I don’t.
Yunus it is probably being injected from the Google Tag Manager then. Have you checked Google Tag Manager to see if the code is in the container?
